definition: the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods/Eastern Zhou (770-221 BC)
pinyin: Chun1 qiu1 Zhan4 guo2 Shi2 dai4

definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods
the Warring States period (475-221 BC)/Japanese Warring States period (15th-17th century)
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
Qin dynasty (221-207 BC), founded by the first emperor Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2], the first dynasty to rule the whole of China
late Warring States period, c. 250-221 BC before the First Emperor's Qin Dynasty
Seven Powerful States of the Warring States, namely: 齊|齐[Qi2], 楚[Chu3], 燕[Yan1], 韓|韩[Han2], 趙|赵[Zhao4], 魏[Wei4] and 秦[Qin2]
Western Han Dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 前漢|前汉[Qian2 Han4], Former Han Dynasty
